column1: Apple Valley is a city in northwestern Dakota County in the State of Minnesota
column2: and a suburb of the Twin Cities. The city's population in 2019 was 55
column3: 135 making it the 17th most populous city in Minnesota. In 2013
column4: Money Magazine named Apple Valley the 17th best place to live in the United States

column1: The area that became Apple Valley was first established in 1858 as Lebanon Township
column2: and remained a farming community for nearly a century.  In the mid-1950s
column3: residential developments started replacing farmland. Orrin Thompson
column5: was responsible for the city's early development. He contracted a company to determine where the next growth in the Twin Cities would be. It was one-half of a mile from County Road 42 and Cedar Avenue. Thompson bought the first houses and streets from the Brobacks
column6: who built the city's first four houses. The firm that selected this area was in Apple Valley
column8: so Thompson took that name for the development. An alternate explanation for the name change exists
column9: however. According to local developer Henry Broback
column10: Lebanon Township was renamed Apple Valley because "...when you drive east on (County Road) 42 and turn to enter Lebanon
column11: it reminded them of Apple Valley
column13: which was a nice community."Voters in the township voted to incorporate in the 1968 general election.  They also selected the name Apple Valley over the name Lebanon Valley by a vote of 1376 to 757.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 17.57 square miles (45.51 km2)
column3: of which 16.86 square miles (43.67 km2) is land and 0.71 square miles (1.84 km2) is water. The city's geography is rolling
column4: with elevation from the lowest to the highest points in the city varying by a hundred feet or more. The downtown area and its adjacent residential district (which formed the original core of the city when it was incorporated) are in a shallow valley.

column1: Apple Valley is in Minnesota's 2nd congressional district
column2: represented by Angie Craig
column3: a Democrat. Apple Valley is represented in the Minnesota Legislature by State Senator Greg Clausen (Democrat

column1: Apple valley hosts an annual July 4 festival called "Apple Valley Freedom Days" Festivities include one of the areas biggest parades that features local marching bands
column2: service organizations
column3: and many local businesses. There is also a carnival and a fireworks display during the event.

column1: In the February the city hosts the Apple Valley Winter Carnival. Events include ice skating
column2: a medallion hunt
column3: contests and children events.

column1: Apple Valley is home to the Minnesota Zoo
column2: a nationally recognized zoological garden that houses hundreds of animals from several distinct climatological zones. Collections include an indoor Tropics Trail featuring animals from the worlds rain forests and tropical habitats
column3: the Minnesota Trail with native animals from Minnesota including black bears
column5: wolverines and beaver pond. The Northern Trail features large animals from the worlds cold climates. Highlights of this trail are musk ox
column7: Takins from China and animals from remote east coast including brown bears
column9: and wild boars. The zoo also features an aquarium
column10: an exhibit of penguins from South Africa and the popular Japanese snow monkeys

column2: three middle and three high schools in the city
column3: all operated by Independent School District 196. In addition to the two comprehensive high schools
column4: Apple Valley is home to a magnet school open to 11th and 12th graders
column5: the School of Environmental Studies. In fall 2007
column6: Independent School District 196 opened three elementary-level magnet schools: Cedar Park Elementary
column9: Engineering and Math (STEM) magnet; Diamond Path Elementary
column10: which will have an International Studies theme
column12: with an Arts and Science theme. In 2017
column13: Independent School District 196 opened a new Elementary school in neighboring Lakeville
column14: Minnesota. Some students attend public schools in other school districts chosen by their families under Minnesota's open enrollment statute.

column2: Cedar Avenue
column3: and County Road 42 are three of the main routes in Apple Valley. Highway 77 briefly enters the northern part of Apple Valley and becomes County Road 23 / Cedar Avenue.

column1: Minnesota Valley Transit Authority operates many weekday commuter buses to and from Downtown Minneapolis and Saint Paul. The recently built Red Line operates as a dedicated bus line with service to and from the Mall of America.
